thread.title: Ryerson Image Centre to host Weegee photo exhibition 'Murder Is My Business'
thread.title_full: Ryerson Image Centre to host Weegee photo exhibition 'Murder Is My Business' - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Canadian Press
title: Ryerson Image Centre to host Weegee photo exhibition 'Murder Is My Business'
text:
TORONTO - The Ryerson Image Centre will host an exhibition this fall of photographs taken in the 1930s and '40s by the legendary New York City photojournalist known as Weegee.
"Weegee: Murder Is My Business" travels to Ryerson from New York's International Center of Photography, which holds the Weegee Archive.

The photo "Unidentified Photographer," On the Spot, December 9, 1939 is shown in a handout photo.The Ryerson Image Centre will host an exhibition this fall of photographs taken in the 1930s and '40s by the legendary New York City photojournalist known as Weegee.THE CANADIAN PRESS/HO-International Center of Photography 
Weegee, the pseudonym of Arthur Fellig, produced garish images of crime scenes and car crashes, setting the standard for tabloid journalism. He claimed to have covered 5,000 murders.
"His best photographs combine wit, daring and surprisingly original points of view," said exhibition curator Brian Wallis.
There are 113 photographs in the exhibition, as well as other items including one of Weegee's cameras, his hat and press pass.
The show runs Oct. 14 to Dec. 13.
———
